TEI.2.document_title: F. W. Johnson to Stephen F. Austin, 10-01-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: F. W. Johnson to Austin, October 1, 1826. Application for employment.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1468

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*F. W. Johnson to Austin, October 1, 1826. Application for employment.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="01-01-1826">Oct. 1st 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir,*/p* *p*In consequence of a sick *person_mentioned*friend*/person_mentioned*, it is out of my power to see you personally, therefore I have taken the liberty of stating my business in writing; I have verry lately emmigrated to your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*, with an expectation of gitting into business that would be profitable to myself and beneficial to *person_mentioned*those by whom I was employed*/person_mentioned*; therefore if there should be any surveying, or vacancies in the office of *person_mentioned*clerks*/person_mentioned* within the gift of your power, I would gladly and thankfully accept the same.—Your answer to this by *person_mentioned*Mr. Moore*/person_mentioned* or *person_mentioned*Col. Night*/person_mentioned* will confer a favour.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Francis W. Johnson */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p*P. S.*/p*
*p*I also send you a letter of recommendation from *person_mentioned*Capt. S. C. Hirom*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*F. W. Johnson */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
